title: Thinking Outside the (Gray) Box: A Context-Based Score for Assessing Value and Originality in Neural Text Generation
author: Giorgio Franceschelli (University of Bologna), Mirco Musolesi (University College London), ...
relevance_why: The proposed CoVO score could inform new metrics for evaluating generative models in audio synthesis tasks, potentially improving the creativity and diversity of generated audio.
background: Investigating how to evaluate and enhance the creativity of generative models, particularly focusing on value and originality through a novel scoring system.
contribution: This paper introduces the CoVO score to assess the value and originality of neural-generated text, achieving improved diversity without sacrificing accuracy.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily assessed output quality or diversity independently without integrating both dimensions effectively.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines mutual information metrics to quantify both value and originality simultaneously, offering a more holistic evaluation.

key_innovation: The CoVO score uniquely integrates value and originality into a single evaluative framework, allowing generative models to optimize for both metrics in text generation.
real_world_impact: This method could enhance the applicability of large language models in creative applications, yielding outputs that are both novel and contextually valuable.
limitations: The requirement for substantial computational resources for training may limit accessibility.

new_terms.CoVO score: **CoVO score** is a scoring mechanism used to evaluate the creativity of generated outputs, measuring both their relevance to the task and their originality based on mutual information theory.
